subject: Question about how to test data
msgSnippet: Hi, I have a question about techniques or approaches for testing data.  I don t want to test all data , I want to test a subset of all data...specifically
messageBody:
Hi,

I have a question about techniques or approaches for testing data. I
don't want to test all "data", I want to test a subset of all
data...specifically what I am going to call reference data....or meta
data.

I want to try and be clear what I mean by reference data...or meta data.
This reference data or meta data is different than data that is used by
a test as a fixture...and different than transactional data that might
be generated.

In this application I am testing there are these tables ....I guess I
will call them assignment tables. Every row...and there are many
hundreds of rows....defines a requirement or some specific behavior.
Suppose there are 7 columns in this table....the first 6 columns define
some criteria that is matched against...and the 7th column defines some
outcome.

So it is easy enough to write 1 JUnit test to test how this table is
used in the functional requirement. I know the code, specifically,
works as it uses this table. But I want to know if all the data in
this table is correct...because each row is really a unique requirement
that is implemented in data.

So I could write hundreds of tests ....one for each row of data in this
table....but this is obviously not the best approach.

I guess my problem statement is this: the business analysts have an
Excel spreadsheet with hundreds of rows...each row defines some unique
requirement on the way this particular thing is supposed to work. Each
row in this spreadsheet, each requirement if you will, is not
implemented in code.....but in data...which I am calling reference data
or meta data....in this table.

I am fishing for thoughts on how people might go about testing this....

Thoughts?

Mike
